text.4: Congrats to Informatics faculty member @pgnagy for being the recipient of the 2020 Service Award from the American College of Medical Quality (ACMQ). This award is for outstanding service by a member and recognizes his contributions to the field of medical quality management. https://t.co/nmlaX59rzx
text.5:
Many of us continue to think about how to impact patients beyond the operating room or hospital setting.

This past year in the office of @SenatorHassan underscored the importance of HCWs playing a role in shaping policy.

text.8: It is well-documented that early rehabilitation, especially in the ICU, can lead to faster recovery times. For @MGFBmd and her colleagues, this is ever-more important for those recovering from COVID-19. https://t.co/8A10mpK5NF

text.13: Initially, brain-computer interface research for quadriplegia has largely focused on only 1 arm that was controlled from only one side of the brain. However, Buz has been able to control both prosthetic arms with only his thoughts. @Medscape @RehabHopkins https://t.co/Bduk3O69RC
